summary.p: The Attuvaitāṉupavam, “Experience of Non-Duality” (Sanskrit advaita + anubhava), is a philosophical text, of which there seems to exist no printed edition yet. According to the preface (f76) and the final colophon (f95), the author is Rāmakavi, disciple of Civarāmakavi (Sanskrit Śivarāmakavi), himself disciple of Navamakāleṭcumi Nāraciṅkatēcikar (Sanskrit Navamahālakṣmī Nārasiṃhadeśika). In the present manuscript the work consists of 128 stanzas.

The text in U2 is complete. We find successively:
An invocatory stanza (f75r).
3 stanzas of pāyiram, “preface” (f76r‒f76v), also titled kuruvaṇakkam (f76r, lm and f76v1), “hommage to preceptor”.
The main text (mūlam) (f77r‒f94v), divided in 12 chapters, each of 10 stanzas.
A kind of postface in 4 stanzas (f95r‒f95v), explaining the origin of the work.

filiation.p: Other manuscript testimonies of this text are kept in the GOML: D. 1428–1430 (Kuppuswami Sastri 1927, pp. 1240–2), R. 1342 (Fazlullah and Chandrasekharan 1949, p. 2228). See also Chandrasekharan (1951: n° 106).

collation.desc: 1 folio = title page. No foliation. Hand #1.
21 folios = Attuvaitāṉupavam: mūlam. Tamil foliation 76‒95 and parallel Tamil foliation [1]‒20. Hand #2.

supportDesc.condition: Very good state of preservation, in spite of bore holes caused by insects.

desc.p:
The beginning of each chapter is indicated by an intertitle in the left margin, whereas a completion statement and total stanzas so far (including those of the pāyiram) are found at the end of each chapter. Occasionally the title of the next chapter is also given. See, e.g.:
pāyiram kuruvaṇakkam (f76r, lm) & kuruvaṇakkamuttum [i.e. kuruvaṇakkamuṟṟum] = yippāl atikāralaṭcaṇam = (f76v1)
atikāralaṭcaṇam (f77r, lm) & atikāralaṭcaṇamuṟṟum = {āka} pāyiram uḷpaṭa tiruviruttam – 13 = iraṇṭāvatu – attiyālōpavvavātam (i.e. attiyārōpavvavātam, cf. f78v, lm) = (f78r8‒9)
[12]{āvatu} vivēkacōrūpam (f93v, lm)
vivēkacōrūpamuṟṟum = {āka} atikāram – 12uk=ku pāyiram uḷpaṭa tiruviruttam – 123 = (f94v8‒9)

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Before 1855, as it is part of Ariel’s bequest made in that year to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868). Ca. 1835 according to Vinson (1867-1868, p. 1) and Cabaton (1912, p. 54), on unkwown grounds.

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

encodingDesc.p: Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is not clearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kāl or length of o and e) readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated by slash. Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only).
